required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Evaluate a 13-valent Pneumococcal Conjugate Vaccine in Infants
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3, Randomized, Active-Controlled, Double-Blind Trial Evaluating the Safety, Tolerability, and Immunogenicity of a 13-valent Pneumococcal Conjugate Vaccine in Healthy Infants Given With Routine Pediatric Vaccinations in the United Kingdom

lead_sponsor.agency: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

clinical_study.source: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the safety, tolerability and immunogenicity of a 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate (13vPnC) vaccine compared to Prevenar (7vPnC), when given concomitantly with routine paediatric vaccines in the United Kingdom.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving a Meningococcal C Serum Bactericidal Assay (SBA) Titer ≥1:8 and Predefined Antibody Levels for Pertussis and Haemophilus Influenzae Type b in 13vPnC Group Relative to 7vPnC Group After the 2-dose Infant Series.
primary_outcome.time_frame: One month after infant series dose 2 (5 months of age)
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants achieving a meningococcal C SBA serum antibody titer ≥1:8 and predefined antibody threshold levels with the corresponding 95% CI for concomitant antigens polyribosylribitol phosphate (PRP) in haemophilus influenzae type b [Hib](≥0.15 μg/mL or ≥ 1.0 μg/mL), pertussis toxoid [PT], filamentous haemagglutinin, pertactin [FHA], and pertactin (PRN) (≥5 Elisa Units EU/mL) and fimbrial agglutinogens [FIM] (≥2.2 EU/mL) are presented.

primary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean Titer (GMT) of Meningococcal C Antigen as Measured by SBA in 13vPnC Group Relative to 7vPnC Group After the 2-dose Infant Series
primary_outcome.time_frame: one month after infant series dose 2 (5 months of age)

primary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean Antibody Concentration of Haemophilus Influenzae Type b (Hib) Polyribosylribitol Phosphate (PRP) as Measured by Enzyme-linked Immunosorbent Assay (ELISA) in 13vPnC Group Relative to 7vPnC Group After the 2-dose Infant Series
primary_outcome.time_frame: one month after infant series dose 2 (5 months of age)

primary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean Antibody Concentration of Pertusis Filamentous Haemagglutinin (FHA), Pertussis Toxoid (PT), Pertactin (PRN), and Fimbrial Agglutinogens (FIM) as Measured by ELISA in 13vPnC Group Relative to 7vPnC Group After the 2-dose Infant Series
primary_outcome.time_frame: one month after infant series dose 2 (5 months of age)

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants in the 13vPnC Group Achieving a Serotype-specific IgG Antibody Concentration ≥0.35 µg/mL Measured 1 Month After the 2-dose Infant Series, Before and After the Toddler Dose
primary_outcome.time_frame: one month after infant series dose 2 (5 months of age), before and after toddler dose (12 months of age)
primary_outcome.description: Percentages of participants achieving WHO predefined antibody threshold ≥0.35μg/mL along with the corresponding 95% CI for the 7 common pneumococcal serotypes (serotypes 4, 6B, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F, and 23F) and 6 additional pneumococcal serotypes specific to 13vPnC (serotypes 1, 3, 5, 6A, 7F, and 19A) are presented.

primary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean Antibody Concentration in 13vPnC Group After the 2-dose Infant Series, Before and After the Toddler Dose.
primary_outcome.time_frame: one month after infant series dose 2 (5 months of age) and before and after toddler dose (12 months of age)
primary_outcome.description: Antibody concentration/geometric mean concentration (GMC) as measured by ELISA for 7 common pneumococcal serotypes (serotypes 4, 6B, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F, and 23F) and 6 additional pneumococcal serotypes specific to 13vPnC (Serotypes 1, 3, 5, 6A, 7F, and 19A) are presented with corresponding 2-sided 95% CI.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving an SBA Titer ≥1:8 for Meningococcal C in 13vPnC Group Relative to 7vPnC Group Before and After the Toddler Dose.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: one month after the toddler dose (13 months of age)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving a Predefined Antibody Level for Haemophilus Influenzae Type b in the 13vPnC Group Relative to the 7vPnC Group After the Toddler Dose.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: one month after toddler dose (13 months of age)

secondary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean Antibody Concentration for Haemophilus Influenzae Type b PRP in 13vPnC Group Relative to 7vPnC Group After the Toddler Dose.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: one month after toddler dose (13 months of age)

secondary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean Titer (GMT) of Meningococcal C Antigen as Measured by SBA in 13vPnC Group Relative to 7vPnC Group After the Toddler Dose
secondary_outcome.time_frame: one month after toddler dose (13 months of age)

other_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Reporting Pre-Specified Local Reactions
other_outcome.time_frame: During the 4-day period after each dose
other_outcome.description: Local reactions were reported using an electronic diary. Tenderness was scaled as Any (tenderness present); Significant (present and interfered with limb movement). Induration and erythema were scaled as Any (induration or erythema present); Mild (0.5 centimeters [cm] to 2.0 cm); Moderate (2.5 to 7.0 cm); Severe (> 7.0 cm). Participants may be represented in more than 1 category.

other_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Reporting Pre-Specified Systemic Events
other_outcome.time_frame: During the 4-day period after each dose
other_outcome.description: Systemic events (fever ≥ 38 degrees Celsius [C] but ≤ 39 C, fever >39 C but ≤ 40 C, fever > 40 C, decreased appetite, irritability, increased sleep, decreased sleep, use of medication (Meds) to prevent symptoms, and use of medication to treat symptoms) were collected using an electronic diary; percentage of participants with each event was evaluated.

intervention.description: Single 0.5 mL dose given at 2, 3, 4, and 12 months of age
Single 0.5 mL dose given at 2, 3, 4 and 12 months of age
concommitant vaccine, both at arm 1 and at arm 2, at 2 months, 3 months and 4 months of age
concomittant vaccine, both at arm 1 and at arm 2, at 2 months and 4 months of age
concomitant vaccine, both at arm 1 and at arm 2, at 12 months of age

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Aged 2 months (42 to 98 days) at the time of enrollment.
2. Available for entire study period and whose parent(s)/legal guardian(s) could be reached by telephone.
3. Healthy infant, as determined by medical history, physical examination, and judgment of the investigator.
4. Parent(s)/legal guardian(s) had to be able to complete all relevant study procedures during study participation.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Previous vaccination with licensed or investigational pneumococcal vaccine.
2. Previous vaccination with Hib conjugate, diphtheria, tetanus, pertussis, polio, or meningococcal vaccines.
3. A previous anaphylactic reaction to any vaccine or vaccine-related component.
4. Contraindication to vaccination with Hib conjugate, diphtheria, tetanus, pertussis, polio, pneumococcal conjugate, or meningococcal conjugate vaccines.
5. Bleeding diathesis or condition associated with prolonged bleeding time that would contraindicate intramuscular injection.
6. Known or suspected immune deficiency or suppression.
7. History of culture-proven invasive disease caused by S pneumoniae, Neisseria meningitidis, or Hib.
8. Major known congenital malformation or serious chronic disorder.
9. Significant neurological disorder or history of seizure, including febrile seizure, or significant stable or evolving disorders, such as cerebral palsy, encephalopathy, hydrocephalus, or other significant disorders. This did not include resolving syndromes due to birth trauma such as Erb palsy.
10. Receipt of blood products or gamma-globulin (including hepatitis B immunoglobulin and monoclonal antibodies; eg, Synagis®).
11. Participation in another investigational trial. Participation in purely observational studies was acceptable.
12. Infant who was a direct descendant (eg, child or grandchild) of the study site personnel.

overall_official.affiliation: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were recruited in the United Kingdom (UK) from October 2006 to June 2007.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Participants were enrolled into the study according to inclusion/exclusion criteria without a screening period.

group.title: 13vPnC
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC) coadministered with meningococcal C-tetanus toxoid conjugate vaccine (NeisVac-C) and a combined diphtheria, tetanus, five component acellular pertussis (DT5aP), inactivated poliomyelitis (IPV) and haemophilus influenzae type b (Hib) conjugate vaccine (Pediacel) at the 2- and 4-month visits (infant series). Pediacel was administered without study vaccine at 3-month visit. Participants recieved one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with Haemophilus Influenzae Type b (Hib) and Meningococcal C Vaccine (Menitorix) at the 12-month visit (toddler dose).

group.title: 7vPnC
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (7vPnC) coadministered with meningococcal C-tetanus toxoid conjugate vaccine (NeisVac-C) and a combined diphtheria, tetanus, five component acellular pertussis (DT5aP), inactivated poliomyelitis (IPV) and haemophilus influenzae type b (Hib) conjugate vaccine (Pediacel) at the 2- and 4-month visits (infant series). Pediacel was administered without study vaccine at 3-month visit. Participants recieved one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with Haemophilus Influenzae Type b (Hib) and Meningococcal C Vaccine (Menitorix) at the 12-month visit (toddler dose).

group.title: 13vPnC
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC) coadministered with meningococcal C-tetanus toxoid conjugate vaccine (NeisVac-C) and a combined diphtheria, tetanus, five component acellular pertussis (DT5aP), inactivated poliomyelitis (IPV) and haemophilus influenzae type b (Hib) conjugate vaccine (Pediacel) at the 2- and 4-month visits (infant series). Pediacel was administered without study vaccine at 3-month visit. Participants recieved one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with Haemophilus Influenzae Type b (Hib) and Meningococcal C Vaccine (Menitorix) at the 12-month visit (toddler dose).

group.title: 7vPnC
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (7vPnC) coadministered with meningococcal C-tetanus toxoid conjugate vaccine (NeisVac-C) and a combined diphtheria, tetanus, five component acellular pertussis (DT5aP), inactivated poliomyelitis (IPV) and haemophilus influenzae type b (Hib) conjugate vaccine (Pediacel) at the 2- and 4-month visits (infant series). Pediacel was administered without study vaccine at 3-month visit. Participants recieved one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with Haemophilus Influenzae Type b (Hib) and Meningococcal C Vaccine (Menitorix) at the 12-month visit (toddler dose).

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Achieving a Meningococcal C Serum Bactericidal Assay (SBA) Titer ≥1:8 and Predefined Antibody Levels for Pertussis and Haemophilus Influenzae Type b in 13vPnC Group Relative to 7vPnC Group After the 2-dose Infant Series.
outcome.description: Percentage of participants achieving a meningococcal C SBA serum antibody titer ≥1:8 and predefined antibody threshold levels with the corresponding 95% CI for concomitant antigens polyribosylribitol phosphate (PRP) in haemophilus influenzae type b [Hib](≥0.15 μg/mL or ≥ 1.0 μg/mL), pertussis toxoid [PT], filamentous haemagglutinin, pertactin [FHA], and pertactin (PRN) (≥5 Elisa Units EU/mL) and fimbrial agglutinogens [FIM] (≥2.2 EU/mL) are presented.
outcome.time_frame: One month after infant series dose 2 (5 months of age)
outcome.population: Evaluable immunogenicity (per protocol) population consisting of eligible participants who adhered to the protocol requirements, had valid and determinate assay results, and had no other major protocol violations; (n) = number of participants with a determinate postinfant series antibody concentration to the given concomitant antigen.

group.title: 13vPnC
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC) coadministered with meningococcal C-tetanus toxoid conjugate vaccine (NeisVac-C) and a combined diphtheria, tetanus, five component acellular pertussis (DT5aP), inactivated poliomyelitis (IPV) and haemophilus influenzae type b (Hib) conjugate vaccine (Pediacel) at the 2- and 4-month visits (infant series). Pediacel was administered without study vaccine at 3-month visit. Participants recieved one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with Haemophilus Influenzae Type b (Hib) and Meningococcal C Vaccine (Menitorix) at the 12-month visit (toddler dose).

group.title: 7vPnC
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (7vPnC) coadministered with meningococcal C-tetanus toxoid conjugate vaccine (NeisVac-C) and a combined diphtheria, tetanus, five component acellular pertussis (DT5aP), inactivated poliomyelitis (IPV) and haemophilus influenzae type b (Hib) conjugate vaccine (Pediacel) at the 2- and 4-month visits (infant series). Pediacel was administered without study vaccine at 3-month visit. Participants recieved one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with Haemophilus Influenzae Type b (Hib) and Meningococcal C Vaccine (Menitorix) at the 12-month visit (toddler dose).

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Achieving a Meningococcal C Serum Bactericidal Assay (SBA) Titer ≥1:8 and Predefined Antibody Levels for Pertussis and Haemophilus Influenzae Type b in 13vPnC Group Relative to 7vPnC Group After the 2-dose Infant Series.
measure.description: Percentage of participants achieving a meningococcal C SBA serum antibody titer ≥1:8 and predefined antibody threshold levels with the corresponding 95% CI for concomitant antigens polyribosylribitol phosphate (PRP) in haemophilus influenzae type b [Hib](≥0.15 μg/mL or ≥ 1.0 μg/mL), pertussis toxoid [PT], filamentous haemagglutinin, pertactin [FHA], and pertactin (PRN) (≥5 Elisa Units EU/mL) and fimbrial agglutinogens [FIM] (≥2.2 EU/mL) are presented.
measure.population: Evaluable immunogenicity (per protocol) population consisting of eligible participants who adhered to the protocol requirements, had valid and determinate assay results, and had no other major protocol violations; (n) = number of participants with a determinate postinfant series antibody concentration to the given concomitant antigen.

analysis.groups_desc: For Meningococcal C the difference in percentage between the two groups (13vPnC - 7vPnC) at 1:8 titer was calculated
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority for concomitant antigens was declared if the lower limit of 2-sided 95% CI for the difference between the 2 groups (13vPnC - 7vPnC) > -10%.

analysis.groups_desc: For Haemophilus influenzae type b the difference in percentage between the two groups (13vPnC - 7vPnC) at 0.15 µg/mL threshold was calculated
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority for concomitant antigens was declared if the lower limit of 2-sided 95% CI for the difference between the 2 groups (13vPnC – 7vPnC) > -10%.

analysis.groups_desc: For Haemophilus influenzae type b the difference in percentage between the two groups (13vPnC - 7vPnC) at 1.0 µg/mL threshold was calculated
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority for concomitant antigens was declared if the lower limit of 2-sided 95% CI for the difference between the 2 groups (13vPnC – 7vPnC) > -10%.

analysis.groups_desc: For Pertussis PT the difference in percentage between the two groups (13vPnC - 7vPnC) at 5 EU/mL threshold was calculated
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority for concomitant antigens was declared if the lower limit of 2-sided 95% CI for the difference between the 2 groups (13vPnC – 7vPnC) > -10%.

analysis.groups_desc: For Pertussis PT the difference in percentage between the two groups (13vPnC - 7vPnC) at 17 EU/mL threshold was calculated

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Achieving an SBA Titer ≥1:8 for Meningococcal C in 13vPnC Group Relative to 7vPnC Group Before and After the Toddler Dose.
outcome.time_frame: one month after the toddler dose (13 months of age)
outcome.population: Evaluable immunogenicity (per protocol) population consisting of eligible participants who adhered to protocol requirements, had valid and determinate assay results, and had no other major protocol violations; (n)= number of participants with a determinate posttoddler dose antibody concentration to the given concomitant antigen.

group.title: 13vPnC Before Toddler Dose
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with NeisVac-C at the 2- and 4-month visits, Pediacel at the 2-, 3-, and 4-month visits.

group.title: 7vPnC Before Toddler Dose
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with NeisVac-C at the 2- and 4-month visits, Pediacel at the 2-, 3-, and 4-month visits.

group.title: 13vPnC After Toddler Dose
group.description: Participants received Menitorix at the 12-month visit.

group.title: 7vPnC After Toddler Dose
group.description: Participants received Menitorix at the 12-month visit.

outcome.title: Geometric Mean Titer (GMT) of Meningococcal C Antigen as Measured by SBA in 13vPnC Group Relative to 7vPnC Group After the 2-dose Infant Series
outcome.time_frame: one month after infant series dose 2 (5 months of age)
outcome.population: Evaluable immunogenicity (per protocol) population consisting of eligible participants who adhered to the protocol requirements, had valid and determinate assay results, and had no other major protocol violations;(N) = number of participants with a determinate antibody concentration/titer for the specified concomitant antigen.

group.title: 13vPnC
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC) coadministered with meningococcal C-tetanus toxoid conjugate vaccine (NeisVac-C) and a combined diphtheria, tetanus, five component acellular pertussis (DT5aP), inactivated poliomyelitis (IPV) and haemophilus influenzae type b (Hib) conjugate vaccine (Pediacel) at the 2- and 4-month visits (infant series). Pediacel was administered without study vaccine at 3-month visit. Participants recieved one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with Haemophilus Influenzae Type b (Hib) and Meningococcal C Vaccine (Menitorix) at the 12-month visit (toddler dose).

group.title: 7vPnC
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (7vPnC) coadministered with meningococcal C-tetanus toxoid conjugate vaccine (NeisVac-C) and a combined diphtheria, tetanus, five component acellular pertussis (DT5aP), inactivated poliomyelitis (IPV) and haemophilus influenzae type b (Hib) conjugate vaccine (Pediacel) at the 2- and 4-month visits (infant series). measure.title: Geometric Mean Titer (GMT) of Meningococcal C Antigen as Measured by SBA in 13vPnC Group Relative to 7vPnC Group After the 2-dose Infant Series
measure.population: Evaluable immunogenicity (per protocol) population consisting of eligible participants who adhered to the protocol requirements, had valid and determinate assay results, and had no other major protocol violations;(N) = number of participants with a determinate antibody concentration/titer for the specified concomitant antigen.

analysis.groups_desc: For Meningococcal C the GMC ratio (13vPnC/7vPnC) was calculated
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority for the concomitant antigens was declared if the lower bound of the 2-sided, 95% CI for the GMC ratio (13vPnC group/7vPnC group) was >0.5 (2-fold criterion).

outcome.title: Geometric Mean Antibody Concentration of Haemophilus Influenzae Type b (Hib) Polyribosylribitol Phosphate (PRP) as Measured by Enzyme-linked Immunosorbent Assay (ELISA) in 13vPnC Group Relative to 7vPnC Group After the 2-dose Infant Series
outcome.time_frame: one month after infant series dose 2 (5 months of age)
outcome.population: Evaluable immunogenicity (per protocol) population consisting of eligible participants who adhered to the protocol requirements, had valid and determinate assay results, and had no other major protocol violations;(N) = number of participants with a determinate antibody concentration/titer for the specified concomitant antigen.

Participants recieved one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with Haemophilus Influenzae Type b (Hib) and Meningococcal C Vaccine (Menitorix) at the 12-month visit (toddler dose).

measure.title: Geometric Mean Antibody Concentration of Haemophilus Influenzae Type b (Hib) Polyribosylribitol Phosphate (PRP) as Measured by Enzyme-linked Immunosorbent Assay (ELISA) in 13vPnC Group Relative to 7vPnC Group After the 2-dose Infant Series
measure.population: Evaluable immunogenicity (per protocol) population consisting of eligible participants who adhered to the protocol requirements, had valid and determinate assay results, and had no other major protocol violations;(N) = number of participants with a determinate antibody concentration/titer for the specified concomitant antigen.

analysis.groups_desc: For Haemophilus influenzae type b the GMC ratio (13vPnC/7vPnC) was calculated
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority for the concomitant antigens was declared if the lower bound of the 2-sided, 95% CI for the GMC ratio (13vPnC group/7vPnC group) was >0.5 (2-fold criterion).

outcome.title: Geometric Mean Antibody Concentration of Pertusis Filamentous Haemagglutinin (FHA), Pertussis Toxoid (PT), Pertactin (PRN), and Fimbrial Agglutinogens (FIM) as Measured by ELISA in 13vPnC Group Relative to 7vPnC Group After the 2-dose Infant Series
outcome.time_frame: one month after infant series dose 2 (5 months of age)
outcome.population: Evaluable immunogenicity (per protocol) population consisting of eligible participants who adhered to the protocol requirements, had valid and determinate assay results, and had no other major protocol violations;(n) = number of participants with a determinate antibody concentration/titer for the specified concomitant antigen.

group.title: 13vPnC
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC) coadministered with meningococcal C-tetanus toxoid conjugate vaccine (NeisVac-C) and a combined diphtheria, tetanus, five component acellular pertussis (DT5aP), inactivated poliomyelitis (IPV) and haemophilus influenzae type b (Hib) conjugate vaccine (Pediacel) at the 2- and 4-month visits (infant series). Pediacel was administered without study vaccine at 3-month visit. Participants recieved one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with Haemophilus Influenzae Type b (Hib) and Meningococcal C Vaccine (Menitorix) at the 12-month visit (toddler dose).

group.title: 13vPnC
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC) coadministered with meningococcal C-tetanus toxoid conjugate vaccine (NeisVac-C) and a combined diphtheria, tetanus, five component acellular pertussis (DT5aP), inactivated poliomyelitis (IPV) and haemophilus influenzae type b (Hib) conjugate vaccine (Pediacel) at the 2- and 4-month visits (infant series). measure.title: Geometric Mean Antibody Concentration for Haemophilus Influenzae Type b PRP in 13vPnC Group Relative to 7vPnC Group After the Toddler Dose.
measure.population: Evaluable immunogenicity (per protocol) population of eligible participants who adhered to protocol requirements, had valid and determinate assay results, and had no other major protocol violations; (N) = number of participants with a determinate antibody concentration/titer to the specific concomitant antigen.

analysis.groups_desc: For Haemophilus influenzae type b the GMC ratio (13vPnC/7vPnC) was calculated

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants in the 13vPnC Group Achieving a Serotype-specific IgG Antibody Concentration ≥0.35 µg/mL Measured 1 Month After the 2-dose Infant Series, Before and After the Toddler Dose
outcome.description: Percentages of participants achieving WHO predefined antibody threshold ≥0.35μg/mL along with the corresponding 95% CI for the 7 common pneumococcal serotypes (serotypes 4, 6B, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F, and 23F) and 6 additional pneumococcal serotypes specific to 13vPnC (serotypes 1, 3, 5, 6A, 7F, and 19A) are presented.
outcome.time_frame: one month after infant series dose 2 (5 months of age), before and after toddler dose (12 months of age)
outcome.population: Evaluable immunogenicity (per protocol) population consisting of eligible participants who adhered to protocol requirements, had valid and determinate assay results, and had no other major protocol violations; (n) = number of participants with a determinate igG antibody concentration to the given serotype.

group.title: 13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 2
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with NeisVac-C at the 2- and 4-month visits, Pediacel at the 2-, 3-, and 4-month visits.

group.title: 13vPnC Before Toddler Dose
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with NeisVac-C at the 2- and 4-month visits, Pediacel at the 2-, 3-, and 4-month visits.

group.title: 13vPnC After Toddler Dose
group.description: Participants received Menitorix at the 12-month visit.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants in the 13vPnC Group Achieving a Serotype-specific IgG Antibody Concentration ≥0.35 µg/mL Measured 1 Month After the 2-dose Infant Series, Before and After the Toddler Dose
measure.description: Percentages of participants achieving WHO predefined antibody threshold ≥0.35μg/mL along with the corresponding 95% CI for the 7 common pneumococcal serotypes (serotypes 4, 6B, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F, and 23F) and 6 additional pneumococcal serotypes specific to 13vPnC (serotypes 1, 3, 5, 6A, 7F, and 19A) are presented.
measure.population: Evaluable immunogenicity (per protocol) population consisting of eligible participants who adhered to protocol requirements, had valid and determinate assay results, and had no other major protocol violations; (n) = number of participants with a determinate igG antibody concentration to the given serotype.

outcome.title: Geometric Mean Antibody Concentration in 13vPnC Group After the 2-dose Infant Series, Before and After the Toddler Dose.
outcome.description: Antibody concentration/geometric mean concentration (GMC) as measured by ELISA for 7 common pneumococcal serotypes (serotypes 4, 6B, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F, and 23F) and 6 additional pneumococcal serotypes specific to 13vPnC (Serotypes 1, 3, 5, 6A, 7F, and 19A) are presented with corresponding 2-sided 95% CI.
outcome.time_frame: one month after infant series dose 2 (5 months of age) and before and after toddler dose (12 months of age)
outcome.population: Evaluable immunogenicity (per protocol) population consisting of eligible participants who adhered to protocol requirements, had valid and determinate assay results, and had no other major protocol violations; (n) = number of participants with a determinate antibody concentration for the specified serotype.

group.title: 13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 2
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with NeisVac-C at the 2- and 4-month visits, Pediacel at the 2-, 3-, and 4-month visits, and Menitorix at the 12-month visit.

group.title: 13vPnC Before Toddler Dose
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with NeisVac-C at the 2- and 4-month visits, Pediacel at the 2-, 3-, and 4-month visits, and Menitorix at the 12-month visit.

group.title: 13vPnC After Toddler Dose
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with NeisVac-C at the 2- and 4-month visits, Pediacel at the 2-, 3-, and 4-month visits, and Menitorix at the 12-month visit.

measure.title: Geometric Mean Antibody Concentration in 13vPnC Group After the 2-dose Infant Series, Before and After the Toddler Dose.
measure.description: Antibody concentration/geometric mean concentration (GMC) as measured by ELISA for 7 common pneumococcal serotypes (serotypes 4, 6B, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F, and 23F) and 6 additional pneumococcal serotypes specific to 13vPnC (Serotypes 1, 3, 5, 6A, 7F, and 19A) are presented with corresponding 2-sided 95% CI.
measure.population: Evaluable immunogenicity (per protocol) population consisting of eligible participants who adhered to protocol requirements, had valid and determinate assay results, and had no other major protocol violations; (n) = number of participants with a determinate antibody concentration for the specified serotype.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Reporting Pre-Specified Local Reactions
outcome.description: Local reactions were reported using an electronic diary. Tenderness was scaled as Any (tenderness present); Significant (present and interfered with limb movement). Induration and erythema were scaled as Any (induration or erythema present); Mild (0.5 centimeters [cm] to 2.0 cm); Moderate (2.5 to 7.0 cm); Severe (> 7.0 cm). Participants may be represented in more than 1 category.
outcome.time_frame: During the 4-day period after each dose
outcome.population: The safety population included all participants who received at least 1 dose of vaccine; (n)= number of participants reporting yes for at least 1 day or no for all days.

group.title: 13vPnC Dose 1
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with NeisVac-C and Pediacel at 2 months of age.

group.title: 7vPnC Dose 1
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with NeisVac-C and Pediacel at 2 months of age.

group.title: 13vPnC Dose 2
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with NeisVac-C and Pediacel at 4 months of age.

group.title: 7vPnC Dose 2
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with NeisVac-C and Pediacel at 4 months of age.

group.title: 13vPnC Toddler Dose
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with Menitorix at 12 months of age.

group.title: 7vPnC Toddler Dose
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with Menitorix at 12 months of age.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Reporting Pre-Specified Local Reactions
measure.description: Local reactions were reported using an electronic diary. Tenderness was scaled as Any (tenderness present); Significant (present and interfered with limb movement). Induration and erythema were scaled as Any (induration or erythema present); Mild (0.5 centimeters [cm] to 2.0 cm); Moderate (2.5 to 7.0 cm); Severe (> 7.0 cm). Participants may be represented in more than 1 category.
measure.population: The safety population included all participants who received at least 1 dose of vaccine; (n)= number of participants reporting yes for at least 1 day or no for all days.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Reporting Pre-Specified Systemic Events
outcome.description: Systemic events (fever ≥ 38 degrees Celsius [C] but ≤ 39 C, fever >39 C but ≤ 40 C, fever > 40 C, decreased appetite, irritability, increased sleep, decreased sleep, use of medication (Meds) to prevent symptoms, and use of medication to treat symptoms) were collected using an electronic diary; percentage of participants with each event was evaluated.
outcome.time_frame: During the 4-day period after each dose
outcome.population: Safety population included all participants who received at least 1 dose of vaccine; (n) = number of participants reporting yes for at least 1 day or no for all days.

group.title: 13vPnC Dose 1
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with NeisVac-C and Pediacel at 2 months of age.

group.title: 7vPnC Dose 1
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with NeisVac-C and Pediacel at 2 months of age.

group.title: 13vPnC Dose 2
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with NeisVac-C and Pediacel at 4 months of age.

group.title: 7vPnC Dose 2
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with NeisVac-C and Pediacel at 4 months of age.

group.title: 13vPnC Toddler Dose
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with Menitorix at 12 months of age.

group.title: 7vPnC Toddler Dose
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with Menitorix at 12 months of age.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Reporting Pre-Specified Systemic Events
measure.description: Systemic events (fever ≥ 38 degrees Celsius [C] but ≤ 39 C, fever >39 C but ≤ 40 C, fever > 40 C, decreased appetite, irritability, increased sleep, decreased sleep, use of medication (Meds) to prevent symptoms, and use of medication to treat symptoms) were collected using an electronic diary; percentage of participants with each event was evaluated.
measure.population: Safety population included all participants who received at least 1 dose of vaccine; (n) = number of participants reporting yes for at least 1 day or no for all days.

outcome.title: Geometric Mean Titer (GMT) of Meningococcal C Antigen as Measured by SBA in 13vPnC Group Relative to 7vPnC Group After the Toddler Dose
outcome.time_frame: one month after toddler dose (13 months of age)

group.title: 13vPnC Infant Series
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC) coadministered with meningococcal C-tetanus toxoid conjugate vaccine (NeisVac-C) and a combined diphtheria, tetanus, five component acellular pertussis (DT5aP), inactivated poliomyelitis (IPV) and haemophilus influenzae type b (Hib) conjugate vaccine (Pediacel) at the 2- and 4-month visits. Pediacel was administered without study vaccine at 3-month visit.

group.title: 7vPnC Infant Series
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (7vPnC) coadministered with meningococcal C-tetanus toxoid conjugate vaccine (NeisVac-C) and a combined diphtheria, tetanus, five component acellular pertussis (DT5aP), inactivated poliomyelitis (IPV) and haemophilus influenzae type b (Hib) conjugate vaccine (Pediacel) at the 2- and 4-month visits. Pediacel was administered without study vaccine at 3-month visit.

group.title: 13vPnC Post-Infant Series
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC) coadministered with meningococcal C-tetanus toxoid conjugate vaccine (NeisVac-C) and a combined diphtheria, tetanus, five component acellular pertussis (DT5aP), inactivated poliomyelitis (IPV) and haemophilus influenzae type b (Hib) conjugate vaccine (Pediacel) at the 2- and 4-month visits (assessment at 5 months of age, 1 month after the infant series). Pediacel was administered without study vaccine at 3-month visit.

group.title: 7vPnC Post-Infant Series
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (7vPnC) coadministered with meningococcal C-tetanus toxoid conjugate vaccine (NeisVac-C) and a combined diphtheria, tetanus, five component acellular pertussis (DT5aP), inactivated poliomyelitis (IPV) and haemophilus influenzae type b (Hib) conjugate vaccine (Pediacel) at the 2- and 4-month visits (assessment at 5 months of age, 1 month after the infant series). Pediacel was administered without study vaccine at 3-month visit.

group.title: 13vPnC Toddler Series
group.description: Participants recieved one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with Haemophilus Influenzae Type b (Hib) and Meningococcal C Vaccine (Menitorix) at the 12-month visit (toddler dose).

group.title: 7vPnC Toddler Series
group.description: Participants recieved one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with Haemophilus Influenzae Type b (Hib) and Meningococcal C Vaccine (Menitorix) at the 12-month visit (toddler dose).

group.title: 13vPnC 6-Month Follow-up
group.description: Participants recieved one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with Haemophilus Influenzae Type b (Hib) & Meningococcal C Vaccine (Menitorix) at the 12-month visit (assessment at 18 months of age, 6 months after the toddler dose).

group.title: 7vPnC 6-Month Follow-up
group.description: Participants recieved one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with Haemophilus Influenzae Type b (Hib) and Meningococcal C Vaccine (Menitorix) at the 12-month visit(assessment at 18 months of age, 6 months after the toddler dose).

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
